    cityhook.com

    Airports are best departed. Find and book the best way between airport and where you need to be.

  • Q: What is Made in Dublin?

    A: Made in Dublin is a crowdsourced list of technology businesses created in the capital of Ireland, Dublin, one of the biggest technology hubs in Europe.
    The businesses listed in this site are founded in Dublin or a large majority of their products are created in Dublin.
    They also display the Made in Dublin logo (coming soon) and link back from their site.

  • Q: What does “are created in Dublin” mean?

    A: Companies listed here have a large proportion of development or manufacturing taking place in Dublin. These provide a software or hardware products. Not only services, i.e. consultancy

  • Q: How do I add my company?

    A: If you meet criteria, submit this form and expect response in about a week. If you know your way around Github, submit a pull request following these steps.

  • Q: How to do add the Made in Dublin logo or text?

    A: Thanks for adding the Made in Dublin logo or text and make the community larger. Please follow these steps.

  • Q: Who designed the logo?

    A: Jade O'Connor

  • Q: What are the categories?

    A: Currently we have three categories:

    • Betas: Early stage startups. Usually with small funding or being bootstrapped.
    • Startups: Startups with less than 500k in funding, usually seed capital and with paying customers (or millions of users).
    • Companies: Late stage startups with more than 500k in funding, usually from VCs.

  • Q: Is there a “Made in Dublin” logo that we can display?

    A: We’re working on it. It is up to you if you want the image or just the text linking back to this site. Our suggestions are:

    • Made in Dublin
    • Crafted in Dublin
    • Made with in Dublin
    • Crafted with in Dublin

  • Q: What about Twitter?

    A: We're on Twitter as you might have noticed. Also our members are collected into Twitter lists:

    • Betas
    • Startups
    • Companies

  • Q: Didn’t I see sites similar to “Made in Dublin”?

    A: That is entirely possible. We would like to thank here Made in New York City and Montreal Collective for inspiration.

  • Q: Want to help or have any feedback?

    A: Email us at hello@madeindublin.org

Collaborators: @alexberegszaszi and @gianpaj
